result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Interpreter appeared earlier as scheduled, but due to court congestion, interpreter was no longer available. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10-11-2022, filed.

Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Reza Uddin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Cerniglia is on vacation; unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-10-2022, filed.

Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel notified the court that he is in trial and unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court cancels the bench warrant. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Court REINSTATES the $2,500.00 signature bond. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Discharge Report 7.8.22, filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,500.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

10:43 AM  Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad not in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. The defendant having failed to appeare, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court. Defendant
Pretrial Services Violation Report 7.1.22; filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.27.2022, filed.
Pretrial Supervision Violation_Report_6.27.22, filed.

Court ordered no contact with SNR (5/5/1978); HNM (5/27/2002)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Sworn as Rohingya interpreter: Uddin, Khinma

Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
